Talk_2003:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I've got to get home and rest up so I'm
ready to work the fields again tomorrow.
Talk_3106:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_00>I gotcha. I'll take great care of 'em.<sp:0:4:0>And if you change your mind again, that's
fine. Just come talk to me about it.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_01>It takes time to raise crops, but once
they're grown, you can harvest 'em when
you want. It's your field, Professor Link!
Talk_3107: <sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>I can hardly wait for the harvest.
Talk_1000:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>You're a traveler, aren't ya? <sp:5:0:0>I'd like to
go traveling myself sometime.<sp:0:4:0>But today, I've got my hands full <clr:0000>tending
the field near the school<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Think_00>Good journey to you, traveler. <sp:5:0:0>And <clr:0000>good
harvest <clr:ffff>to me, I s'pose.
Talk_3108:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>You worried about the field? <sp:5:0:0>Can't think
of why else you'd be out here in the rain.
Talk_1001:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>It's good to see you again, traveler.<sp:0:4:0>I'm off to<clr:0000> tend the field near the school<clr:ffff>.<sp:5:1:0>
Safe travels, young fella.
Talk_3109:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy>No need to fuss over the field so.
The plants aren't going anywhere!
Talk_1002:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_01>I'm up to the same as ever. Goin' off to
<clr:0000>tend the field<clr:ffff>. Here's hopin' we both have
a good one.
Near_1100: It's gonna be a good crop.
Talk_1003:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Well now, traveler! I see the rain hasn't
kept you from runnin' to and fro.<sp:0:4:0>Time was, I'd have been runnin' around
myself, but now...well. If you want to keep
jawin', we should find some cover.
Talk_3200:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Aren't they beauties? It's so good to see
the planties I took special care to grow
all ready for the harvest.<sp:0:4:0>If you want to rotate crops after this,
we can talk about it after you're done
harvestin'.
Talk_1004:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Rain doesn't bother me none! <sp:5:0:0>Aw, who
am I kiddin'? At my age, I can feel a
storm comin' in my bones.<sp:0:4:0>If you want to jaw awhile, could we do it
after we've found a bit of cover?
Talk_3010:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_00>Means a lot that you'd leave the care and
tending of the field to me.<sp:0:4:0>If there's any kind of <clr:0000>crop you need for
your journey<clr:ffff>, Professor Link, you can
count on me to grow it up right.<sp:0:4:0>Just talk to me whenever you decide what
you want this field to be used for.
Talk_3201:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>If you want to rotate crops after this,
we can talk about it after you're done
harvestin'.
Talk_1005:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_01>"Look at me, I'm a traveler. I don't raise
a fuss about a little rain!" <sp:5:0:0>That's what
you're thinking, aren't ya?<sp:0:4:0>I tend crops, so I'm all for the rain.
Even so, I'd rather not get drenched if I
don't have to.<sp:0:4:0><snd:TalkPositive>If you want to jaw awhile, could we do it
after we've found a bit of cover?
Talk_2100:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Well, now. What could you need with me
so late at night?<sp:0:4:0>I'm getting on in years, as you can see.
I need my full night's rest if I don't want
to wake up tired tomorrow.<sp:0:4:0>And I've got an early start, so if you don't
mind, I'll be getting back to sleep.
Talk_3011:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Anything else you want to know about
farmwork? Or are you ready to roll up
our sleeves and get planting?
Talk_2101:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I'm at the age when I need to get a full
night's rest before I'm ready to tend the
school's field again.<sp:0:4:0>Meanin' you'll have to let me sleep some
more tonight. Sorry 'bout that.
Talk_1100:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Think_01>Can't hardly call this a field yet. It'll need
a lot more work before it's through.
Talk_1101:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>You're that traveler who stopped by
before, aren't ya? The one who likes
to take the scenic route?<sp:0:4:0>There must be somethin' about this empty
lot that draws you in, but darn if I know
what it is.<sp:0:4:0>It'll be a spell before the Hateno School
field can <clr:0000>support crops <clr:ffff>again.
Talk_1102:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>You're that traveler who stopped by
before, aren't ya? The kinda nosy one?<sp:0:4:0>Rain's good for the crops, but it always
does a number on my lower back.<sp:0:4:0>Every time it rains, I gotta put my work on
hold. It'll be a spell before the Hateno
School field can <clr:0000>support crops<clr:ffff> again.
Talk_1103:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Ease_01>It'll be a spell before the Hateno School
field can <clr:0000>support crops <clr:ffff>again.
Talk_1104:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:SurpriseS_01>Well, now. <sp:5:0:0>What's a wanderer doing in our
neck of the woods?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700>Going where you please is a perk of being
a traveler, eh? <sp:5:1:0>Chalk it up to fate, and let
me tell you about this place.<sp:0:4:0>This is the <clr:0000>Hateno School<clr:ffff> field. <sp:5:0:0>Right now,
it's more like an empty lot, but it used to
be a good li'l field.<sp:0:4:0>I aim to get it back in shape so it can
support crops again.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01>It's hard work, fixin' up a plot after it's
gone to seed. <sp:5:1:0>It'll be a spell before
anyone can <clr:0000>plant anything<clr:ffff> here.
Near_2000: I put in a good day's work.
Talk_4003: <sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease_00>Well, I'll be. <sp:5:0:0>Don't you know how to rest?
NakedPlayer_01: He hasn't got a stitch on...
Talk_3003:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal_00>I'll rattle off the list for you. I can grow...


Pumpkins, <sp:5:0:0>carrots, <sp:5:0:0>tomatoes, <sp:5:0:0>radishes,<sp:5:0:0>
wildberries,<sp:5:0:0> or hydromelons. Wheat and
rice too. Can't forget those.
Oh, and if it's wheat or rice you're after,
remember you gotta <clr:0000>cut the plants before
you can harvest 'em<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Sad_00>Also, I should come clean about one
thing. <sp:5:0:0>I have more experience with some
crops than others.
I don't know too much yet about raising
endura carrots and hearty radishes.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>You'll have to forgive me if the yield on
those ends up a little lower than the rest.
Talk_3005:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Just talk to me whenever you decide on
what we're growin' here.<sp:0:4:0>I've worked hard to get this field ready,
so it's pretty excitin' to think about it
bein' ready for planting!
Talk_4100:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal_00>By the way, that hat you're wearing...<sp:5:0:0>
Cece designed it, didn't she?<sp:0:4:0>I think it's nice that she's added some
color to our village.
Talk_3006:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Sad>Looks like you don't have anything we
can plant here.<sp:0:4:0>Tell you what though. The general store
here in the village sells a few things we
could try.<sp:0:4:0>Why don't you see if anything they got
grabs you and come back later?
Talk_3008:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Take your time. I'm in no hurry to
get plantin'.
Talk_4103:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease_00>Thank goodness it's just a traveler. I was
so scared that I shrieked before I even
saw who you were.
Talk_3009:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>You can leave me to it. Just know that this
kind of work takes time.<sp:0:4:0>That's all there really is to raisin' crops,
you know. Love and patience.<sp:0:4:0>The veggies take life at their own pace.
Try to hurry things along at an inn or a
fire and you make 'em feel unappreciated.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive>Once they're ripe for pluckin', they're all
yours, Professor Link. Happy trails.
Talk_4104:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease_01>Ah, it's only you. I was afraid it might
be someone suspicious.
Near_1000: Back to the fields I go.
Talk_2000:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>You look like a man who gets around.<sp:5:0:0>
Wish I wasn't so tied down like I am.<sp:0:4:0>On days like this, my <clr:0000>work to tend the
field near the school<clr:ffff> hurts my lower
back so.<sp:0:4:0>It makes the road home feel longer than
it did comin' in.<sp:0:4:0>It's tough work, no mistake. But y'know
what keeps me at it on the hard days?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_01>Knowin' that way, way down the line, what
I do today is gonna keep someone fed.
Talk_3102:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal_00>You won't be able to get back what you've
planted. You don't mind?
Talk_2001:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Good seein' you again, traveler.<sp:0:4:0>I'm on my way home after <clr:0000>tending the
field near the school<clr:ffff>. I've been at it all
day, and I'm tuckered out now.<sp:0:4:0>It's tough work, no mistake. But y'know
what keeps me at it on the hard days?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_01>Knowin' that way, way down the line, what
I do today is gonna keep someone fed.
Talk_2002:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Good seein' you again, traveler. <sp:5:0:0>Not
letting the rain or the dark keep you from
getting around, are you?<sp:0:4:0>I'm on my way home from <clr:0000>tending the
field near the school<clr:ffff>. Bein' out in the wet
doesn't do wonders for my achin' back.<sp:0:4:0>The sooner I get home, the better.<sp:5:0:0>
Safe travels to you, wanderer.
